messages.message:
Hey there!  Just your friendly neighborhood Russian Bear here, checking in and letting you know communication channels are open.  
I assume we're looking at a standard Black Sea bounce, see how the rest of the Spring board looks, and going from there?
messages.input:
My response to TURKEY:'Hey there!  Just your friendly neighborhood Russian Bear here, checking in and letting you know communication channels are open.  
I assume we're looking at a standard Black Sea bounce, see how the rest of the Spring board looks, and going from there?'.

messages.message: Hi yes happy to bounce Black Sea 🌊 what are your thoughts on austria?
messages.input: Message from TURKEY:'Hi yes happy to bounce Black Sea 🌊 what are your thoughts on austria?'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Turkey's inquiry about Austria seems unrelated to the previously mentioned Black Sea bounce strategy, suggesting a shift in focus or potentially an attempt to gather information that could be used against you.

messages.message:
Betrayed?  Bewildered?  Wrong answer?
Seriously, no real opinion formed yet.  He was first to reach out, standard fairly neutral greeting and fishing for info, noncommittal on plans  beyond bouncing Galicia and trying not to anger any of his neighbors.  I could go either way on that one.  Life is a little easier for us if we clear that early.
So far the only player that strikes me as a bit of a wildcard is Italy.  I suspect that one's going to move aggressively and erratically once he picks a direction - and that could be good or bad, depending.
messages.input:
My response to TURKEY:'Betrayed?  Bewildered?  Wrong answer?
Seriously, no real opinion formed yet.  He was first to reach out, standard fairly neutral greeting and fishing for info, noncommittal on plans  beyond bouncing Galicia and trying not to anger any of his neighbors.  I could go either way on that one.  Life is a little easier for us if we clear that early.
So far the only player that strikes me as a bit of a wildcard is Italy.  I suspect that one's going to move aggressively and erratically once he picks a direction - and that could be good or bad, depending.'.

messages.message: Ok bounce in the black and let us assess in the fall
messages.input: Message from TURKEY:'Ok bounce in the black and let us assess in the fall'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Turkey's response aligns with the agreed-upon Black Sea bounce strategy, indicating consistency and cooperation in the communication.

messages.message: *sigh*. This doesn't seem like the most productive way forward for either of us.
messages.input: My response to TURKEY:'*sigh*. This doesn't seem like the most productive way forward for either of us.'.

messages.message: I have been playing a lot of gunboat lately
messages.input: Message from TURKEY:'I have been playing a lot of gunboat lately'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Turkey's statement about playing gunboat games could suggest a potential lack of commitment or coordination in this current game, possibly indicating unreliable and unpredictable behavior.

messages.message: Take Romania I will not hinder it in any way
messages.input: Message from TURKEY:'Take Romania I will not hinder it in any way'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Turkey's willingness to let you take Romania without any obstruction indicates a cooperative attitude and a specific plan of action that could be beneficial for your position.
